lines.content: This is a project template for a greenfield Java project. It's named after the Java mascot _Duke_. Given below are instructions on how to use it.
Prerequisites: JDK 11, update Intellij to the most recent version.
1. Open Intellij (if you are not in the welcome screen, click `File` > `Close Project` to close the existing project first)
1. Open the project into Intellij as follows:
1. Select the project directory, and click `OK`.
1. If there are any further prompts, accept the defaults.
1. Configure the project to use **JDK 11** (not other versions) as explained in [here](https://www.jetbrains.com/help/idea/sdk.html#set-up-jdk).
In the same dialog, set the **Project language level** field to the `SDK default` option.

3. After that, locate the `src/main/java/chatbot.Duke.java` file, right-click it, and choose `Run chatbot.Duke.main()` (if the code editor is showing compile errors, try restarting the IDE). If the setup is correct, you should see something like the below as the output:
### Feature: Add Todo, Deadline or Event

Use app to record todos, deadlines and events with a custom user description for each added entry. Deadlines support due dates and events support start and end dates. Todos, deadlines and events can be removed as well.
Can also search for tasks with keywords from their task description.
Use app to mark/unmark todos/deadlines/events as done or not done yet.
Use app to find todos/deadlines/events by searching the task list for the relavent keyword in their descriptions
List all todos, deadlines and events.
Todos, deadlines and events are saved in between running the program.
Adds a new deadline with description "go to school" with due date of "Friday"
Mark/unmark a todo/event/deadline as done or not done yet using the mark/unmark keyword:
Marks todo/deadline/event in position 1 of list as done
### `list` - Lists all todos, deadlines and events
### `find` - Lists all todos, deadlines and events that contain search term in the description
Bye. Hope to see you again soon!
* This is the deadline class which contains a description as well as a due date. It inherits from the task class
public Deadline(String description, boolean isDone, String deadline){
* This is the chatbot class. This contains an array of Task objects and contains functions to handle them.
* The functions include mark, unmark, find, list, delete and bye functions.
* It also contains the main UI for the app.
private static ArrayList<Task> taskList = new ArrayList<>();
public static void readFile() throws FileFormatException{
public static void main(String[] args) throws InputException, FileFormatException{
System.out.println("What can I do for you?");
// For handling keyword responses with multiple words
System.out.println("deadline [task name] /by [date](Creates a new deadline with deadline [date])");
System.out.println("event [event name] /from [date1] /to [date2] (Creates a new event from [date1] to [date2])");
System.out.println("unmark [task number] (Marks todo/event/deadline as not done yet)");
System.out.println("find [search term] (Finds todos/events/deadlines whose description contains the search term)");
// Check exception: number of words is not 2
throw new InputException("Input Exception: Please enter with correct format (mark [Integer])");
// Check exception: second word cannot be converted to integer or integer out of bounds
throw new InputException("Input Exception: Please enter a positive integer less than or equal to current number of tasks (" + taskList.size() + " task(s))");
throw new InputException("Input Exception: Please enter with correct format (mark [Integer])");
// Check exception: number of words is not 2
throw new InputException("Input Exception: Please enter with correct format (unmark [Integer])");
// Check exception: second word cannot be converted to integer or integer out of bounds
throw new InputException("Input Exception: Please enter a positive integer less than or equal to current number of tasks (" + taskList.size() + ")");
throw new InputException("Input Exception: Please enter with correct format (unmark [Integer])");
throw new InputException("Input Exception: Please ensure that the deadline input is in the correct format\ndeadline [description] /by [date]");
throw new InputException(("Input Exception: Please ensure that the event input is in the correct format\nevent [description] /from [date] /to [date]"));
throw new InputException("Input Exception: Please enter with correct format (delete [Integer])");
throw new InputException("Input Exception: Please enter a positive integer less than or equal to current number of tasks (" + taskList.size() + " task(s))");
System.out.println("Task at index: " + markIndex + " successfully deleted");
throw new InputException("Input Exception: Please enter with correct format (mark [Integer])");
throw new InputException("Input Exception: Invalid input keyword");
System.out.println("Bye. Hope to see you again soon!");
* This is the Event class which contains a task description, event start time and event end time.
* It inherits from the task class.
public Event(String description, boolean isDone, String start, String end){
* This is the task class which is the base class for todo, deadline and event classes.
* All task class objects can be marked as done or not done yet
